comment._content: likely this fellow, a prominent Chicago lawyer: www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=27925221 In January, 1915, he was chief counsel for the new Federal League, attacking the American and National Leagues and the National Commission in an anti-trust suit. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9502EEDD1538E633A... The photo is from Moffett Studios of Chicago, "Chicago's premier venue for visually recording civic culture in the 1910s and 1920s." broadway.cas.sc.edu/index.php?action=showPhotographer&...
